channel.title: Proper way for adding actions to your JButtons?
channel.description: What is the overall best, and proper way in making a JButton go to a new JPanel, where more buttons could be listed? The GUI tutorials don't explain this very well and I would like to know what you all use.

item.title: Proper way for adding actions to your JButtons?
item.dc:creator: @Tico135 Tico
item.description:
@Tico135 wrote:

[quote=“Yz85Racer, post:10, topic:173872”][quote author=Tico135 link=topic=234235.msg2002357#msg2002357 date=1200631884]

As Taharok said, use JPanels. You could do something like:

pane.addTab("Free Worlds", icon, panel, "Free RuneScape Worlds (F2P)");

^ Just an example from my World Switcher Program.

No, that is an example of the use of a JTabbedPane (assumed).

Store the panel and then call JFrame.remove(JPanel). Then just add the new panel to the JFrame and you are done.

[15:16:27] tell him about cardlayout, sum1

Tico, do what lawl said and use a CardLayout. Much better idea than what I posted.

Thankyou all, and thank you lawl and taharok, I saw Frells, and I had one look at it and doubting it instantly, hopefully it works this time.
[/quote]
I fucking laughed, haha.[/quote]

Who wouldn’t frell didn’t code it very well.

Read full topic
item.source: Proper way for adding actions to your JButtons?

As Taharok said, use JPanels. You could do something like:

pane.addTab("Free Worlds", icon, panel, "Free RuneScape Worlds (F2P)");

^ Just an example from my World Switcher Program.

No, that is an example of the use of a JTabbedPane (assumed).

Store the panel and then call JFrame.remove(JPanel). Then just add the new panel to the JFrame and you are done.

[15:16:27] tell him about cardlayout, sum1

Tico, do what lawl said and use a CardLayout. Much better idea than what I posted.
[/quote]

Thankyou all, and thank you lawl and taharok, I saw Frells, and I had one look at it and doubting it instantly, hopefully it works this time. :)[/quote]
I fucking laughed, haha.

pane.addTab("Free Worlds", icon, panel, "Free RuneScape Worlds (F2P)");

^ Just an example from my World Switcher Program.
[/quote]

No, that is an example of the use of a JTabbedPane (assumed).

Store the panel and then call JFrame.remove(JPanel). Then just add the new panel to the JFrame and you are done.

[15:16:27] tell him about cardlayout, sum1
